reviews.text: Best Cathedral ever! I was able to visit several historic churches in Europe, and this is my favorite. It is so immense that it is even difficult to photograph. On the outside it has a dark and sweeping air, the night when illuminated stands out even more, inside, richness, so much that even shaken my faith. Buying tickets is possible to see the treasures of the church, it is not allowed to take photos, but you have to see in person to believe it anyway. But certainly impressive and unforgettable.

The Cathedral is undeniably a place on the very top of the sightseeing tour in Cologne. The extraordinary building is 157 meters tall which makes it the largest Gothic church in Northern Europe. Since 1322 it towers over the trade fair city of Cologne. Due to its height and age it stands continually under construction. The history of the cathedral is also very interested. Clean restrooms can be found at the side of the building.

Gorgeous Gothic Cathedral. A must when visiting Germany. It is amazing from both the inside and the outside. The tower is worth the climbing if you are fit for it (633 steps). This church also has a museum, a little shop, and guided tours at 10:30 am and 2:30 pm. Perfectly located beside the Central Station.

A beautiful and enormous cathedral, free to enter with lots of history and things to see. You can go up the tower (access outside to the right of the entrance) for a small fee, and it's a breathtaking view (not for the faint of heart, especially after like 500 steps). Well worth the time to see it properly.

Absolutely stunning place to see the moment you get off the train. Admission is free (though you can give a donation). It is absolutely breathtaking to see the glass, architecture and to think that it survived the war. One of the best cathedrals we've been to in our travels.

Wunderschöne Kirche, die man gesehen haben sollte. Auch einen Besuch wert, wenn man etwas weiter weg ist. Der Weg lohnt sich . zudem befindet sich die Kirche direkt in der Südstadt, einem Viertel indem man viel unternehmen kann.
아름다운 교회입니다. 밖의 시계가 멋진 곳이지요.
Bonita iglesia de la calle Severinstr de la ciudad de Colonia. Muchas cosas que ver con bonita decoración de Navidad.
Windig,ein. Bischen Regen aber Stimmung ist super
Historischer Ort
Yep, another Roman ruins museum that just amazes me!  All you need is about an hour here. Absolutely loved the reproductions of what the ruins originally looked like.

Loved visiting this site! It’s quite cheap (€4,5pp) and you can spend about 1-1,5hours there. There’s a small museum with some models etc, you can visit the Roman sewer system and an underground ruin. 
One downside: most of the info is in German, there’s only very little info in English. 
Not accessible for wheelchairs and strollers. There’s a restroom and coatcheck available.

Must see place in all of Cologne. Here stood the house of the Roman governor. And for a ~ €3 entry fee this visit is a steal. If you enjoy any amount of history, go here; it's not every day you get to walk through the first few centuries of AD. Could even walk down and through the ancient sewage system.

Perfect program for a rainy/cold day or if you are interested in the Roman history. 
Pretty impressive to see how Cologne used to look like back then. 
The entrance fee is really low and the exhibition really interesting.
Very interested place, which should be visited in Cologne

It's a nice museum. They have a good Picasso collection. If you like modern art, this is the place to go. Close to the Koln main station, so if you have time before the train it takes 1h30/2h00 to see it. Only problem they have a lot of stairs.

Very nice museum with pieces that will take you through a time travel. 
Lots of Picasso’s, but just many other interesting artwork.

Visit here for a good collection of painting including painting of Picasso. It is near by Cologne central railway station. Currently entry fee is 11 euro (year 2019).
There is also workshop organised here for painting. Approx 1 to 2 hour will be sufficient to visit here.You can submit your luggage to clock room for free before entering the museum.
Wow, the depth, breadth,  and quality of the collection,  just Amazing! Great traveling exhibit also.  Art that makes you THINK.

Amazing selection of modern arts, with Picasso, Calder, Matisse, Pollock and Warhol at a special pop art exhibit. There is also a great view of the cathedral and the river in some parts of the museum. The architecture is a plus, with several weird-shaping stories, that demand you to go up and down sometimes. Don't forget to visit their shop afterwards, lots of cool gifts there

We saw the exhibit on American art. Really good with lots of famous paintings. Really had no time to see the rest of the museum. Would like to go back again and see the works by Rembrandt, Monet, etc. One could spend many hours there to take it all in. A bit expensive.
Wonderful selection, I only had 1 1/2 hours to look around, would like to return when I have more time to read everything. Recommend this place if you enjoy art and history.
Once upon a time in America was great show, permanent collection also very interesting with some rare pearls. Highly recommended

Excellent art gallery, a great collection of paintings by well known European artists, a floor dedicated to religious art from the Cologne area, and for another couple of months, an exhibition of art by American artists.
Many of the exhibits have side notes about the artist, and the painting, and available is an audio guide.
Cost of admission is 15 euros, money well spent.
Beautifull place. The art collection is fantastic. Mandatory visit for anyone loving art, while in Cologne.

Very interesting for adults and school children. Big collection of world cultures. Spacious, clean and not expensive at all. It is located in city center and accessible with public transport so you don't have to think about parking. On the ground floor there is also nice caffe and a gift shop.

Good interactive activities, especially for children (who can read). Some unfriendly guards in the exhibits marred our exploration. Good approach to anthropology questions and questions of culture. The temporary Fast Fashion exhibit was sobering. Could have shared more practical ways for people to take action.

Very rich educational resources, good explanations displayed in an innovative way (interactive books, drawers...).
Amazing use of light and space within the exposition and gorgeous collection. 
An unmissable museum.

Fantastic collection with an easy route to follow. My three kids, 8, 11, 13 years old really enjoyed it. They set the pace and it took them 2 hours to get to the end. Anyone with kids with realise it's a miracle.

Very well curated museum with a plethora of fascinating and beautiful artefacts from all over the world. Could easily spend an entire day exploring it in detail. One of the most interesting museums I've ever seen, and definitely one of the best in Cologne. Must see!

You can see every stage of chocolate here and a wide variety of it. The chocolate fountain is the best thing you will see here. The creamy chocolate they provide from the fountain is to die for. You can find all the history related to Cocoa and the other chocolates. There is a huge area for kinder joy where children can have fun and interactive way to learn more about chocolate making process. This is a fun are for all.

If you love chocolate this is the place for you. It costs 11.50 euros for an adult entry. They do offer tours with a guide for an extra charge and different class were they teach you how to make chocolate sweets
The place can be quite busy, you start with how chocolate is grown and the usual information then you go to the place where you can see how they make the chocolate in sweets, smells so yummy. There is a big chocolate fountain which they let you taste the chocolate which is yummy.  There is a coffee shop there as well so you can enjoy a nice hot chocolate or coffee, cake and chocolate fondant, that sort of thing which is not too expensive.

If you come here you should plan to spend most of your day if you are the kind of person who likes to take in the exhibits. There is a TON of information on the processing of chocolate as well as the cultural and historical impact that it has made. The exhibits are very well curated and the samples are generous, especially for the ticket price!

A must for a trip around Cologne. Plenty of attractions for children, mainly educational. Perfectly organized and planned. You can watch the whole process from the kitchen - amazing experience and above all excellent chocolate.
Worth to see

This was a great museum for adults and kids alike. The pictures online make it look much more like an adult museum, however it has soooo much for kids don’t be fooled. You get to watch the entire production up close of chocolate being made, and then at the end a robot will serve you or your kids a piece of the freshest chocolate you likely will ever eat. Great location and awesome history. A must visit for adults and kids alike.
avoid this auction if you can. bought a rhinoceros cup but there was a piece of metal hidden inside the cup base, make this cup very heavy so it would go higher. paid more then 90000 euros
Hervorragend. Auf jeden Fall 5 Sterne.

Sehr empfehlenswertes Kunsthaus. Auch die Auktionen sind sehr gut vorbereitet und durchgeführt. Die Vorlaufkosten für eine Versteigerung sind korrekt und angemessen. Die Schätzungen gehen schnell und professionell über die Bühne. Den Mitarbeitern merkt man an, dass ihnen ihr Beruf Spass macht.

Renommiertes Auktionshaus an zentraler Stelle der Innenstadt.
Freundliche, kompetente und hilfsbereite
Mitarbeiter.
Freundlicher Kontakt - sehr gute Verpackung
Very nice building, rooms and courtyard!
Great event location, especially in the Christmas season when they get out all the lights.
Alaaf
Tolle Location
Wonderful reception facility with a great location. Super classy!

One of the most beautiful places in Cologne. Must see!!! 
Right in the heart of Severinsviertel. 🔝🔝🔝
Es gibt sehr gute Gehörlosengottesdienste in der Kartäuserkirche in Köln von Ehepaar Pfarrer Schwirschke  gepredigt.
Sehr schöne Kirche 😃👍 ⛪
verglichen mit gestern und heute
Sehr schöne und schlichte Kirche
Schöne Kirche
Preiset den Herrn!
Sehr schöne Kirche. Toller Glockenklang!

Incredible views of the city from Cologne triangle...they charge nominal amount of 3 euros....must visit if you are in the city... especially in the evening! The place is normally not so crowded and can offer some good selfie points...the view of bridge and the cathedral is just awesome and very satisfying

Ideal place to get a good overview of the entire city, for less money than you might expect. Overall a wonderful experience. Would sincerely recommend to go in the evening as that adds lots to the experience of being there. If you are in Cologne, you should definitely go here!

Best place to cover the whole Cologne city from 25 the floor of traingle building. You can also take the pictures. Fee is 3€ per head. For group of five people they charged 2.5€ per head. Worth paying.
Only use the parking garage underneath the building. Easy to find, very pleasant (a lot of light). Nothing to complain.
Stunning views over Cologne .. its best at twilight as the lights start to go on around the cathedral and in the old town.
Ein denkwürdiger  Ort
Top
Great store inside the gas station, open 24/7
Normal
24 hrs open and very competitive fuel prices. Easy access and right off the motorway.
English speaking staff! Nice!
Reasonable quality and price.
Lexker, knusprig, empfehlenswert
Ich liebe diese Pizza. Anto ist ein klasse Pizzabäcker und sehr sehr lustig. Wir freuen uns immer wieder wenn wir da essen gehen.
Da gibt es die beste Pizza der Welt. Meine Kinder würden am liebsten jeden Tag dort essen.
Ich liebe eure Pizza😍 und es ist immer lustig bei euch. Danke für die Kalorien😊

I always come here after visiting the sauna at Mauritius hotel. There are loads of options for all tastes - even vegetarians and vegans can eat here with lots of choices. The tables and decor are really nice and so are the staff. The food is really good I can especially recommend the spinach croquettes
Good and tasty tapas. Not many selection of beer.
Cosy place, nice wines

It's a unique bar with very nice interior decor. The food was good and prices are very reasonable. The staff were very friendly and helpful and they knew what they were doing when it came to drinks. Overall it was a pleasant experience and would do it again.
Great atmosphere, great wine.
Best gin bar in Köln !
Great choice of gin! However I did not get much help from the staff.

Best gin bar in Köln

More than 400 gins 

The bartender is a connaiseur and helps chosing according to your taste.

Oh, you can have dinner or other liquids
We enjoy the  food. The salads were very good. The fish soup was delicious. The rozmarin parfe was unique.
Excellent service

It feels like they need an instant renovation. The furnitures look too old fashioned and sometimes I coould even smell it.

The service is a bit stif and the menu doesnt even look inviting enough for a michelin starred restaurant.

I might give this place another try. Maybe. Later. So much later.
Top

Super Geschäft, tolles Restaurant, lecker. Vor allem auch die Vor-Stadion Wurst vom Holzkohlegrill. 

Nur am Spieltag sollte man vorsichtig sein, wenn man mit dem eigenen Wagen anreist. Das städtische Ordnungsamt steht überall mit scharrenden Hufen. 

Wenn das doch nur für irgendwas gut wäre!
Vor jedem FC Spiel Sehr geehrter Herr gute Stimmung

Ich sitze jetzt hier seit einer halben Stunde und warte auf ein Kölsch, langsam nervt es. Die Hochzeit neben an wird gut bedient, während wie daneben seit längerer Zeit auch auf die Karte warten. Bis jetzt ist nur das Ambiente überzeugend!
The sandwich was a mess when i opened it up. Sauce was spilling out.
Good food, good service, good price

New management has done an amazing job taking this location to the next level.  Service is top notch and the food quality has improved exponentially!  Speed of service is noticably faster.  Definitely will be having more quick lunches here in the near future!
Agree! Food quality has gotten so much better since the old owner sold it.
Very friendly/polite staff!
